results:
Based on my search results, I found comprehensive information about Polish translations and editions of "Mały Książę" (The Little Prince). Here's what I discovered:

## Polish Translation History and Publishers of "Mały Książę"

### Early Translation History

Polish was the first language in the world to translate The Little Prince (not counting English, which was published a few days before the French edition). The book was published by Spółdzielnia Wydawnicza Płomienie in Marta Malicka's translation just two years after the war ended (Warsaw, 1947). The next translations into German and Italian had to wait another two years.

The Polish version of "The Little Prince" was first published in 1947 by Spółdzielnia Wydawnicza "Płomienie" in Marta Malicka's translation. Interestingly, before the second Polish translation appeared, on August 12, 1956, the complete text of "The Little Prince" was published in issue 13 of the "Kierunki" magazine, of course in Marta Malicka's translation.

### Multiple Translations and Translators

Polish readers appreciated the touching story of friendship, and as many as 18 different translators undertook the translation of the book in Poland. I managed to count as many as 22 Polish translations!

The version translated by Jan Szwykowski has the most editions – over 50 (as of 2024). "The Little Prince" was also translated by others, including Marta Cywińska, Halina Kozioł, Barbara Przybyłowska, Piotr Drzymała, Wiera and Zbigniew Bieńkowski. However, Jan Szwykowski's translation is probably the most popular.

### Major Polish Publishers

The search results reveal numerous Polish publishers that have released editions of "Mały Książę":

34 publishers in Poland have published "The Little Prince". Some notable publishers mentioned include:

- Wydawnictwo Olesiejuk
- Wydawnictwo Siedmioróg
- Wydawnictwo W.A.B.
- Wydawnictwo Znak
- Polskie Towarzystwo Wydawców Książek, PAX Instytut Wydawniczy, Arcanum - Oficyna Wydawnicza
- Porozumienie Wydawców, De Agostini Polska, Muza - Warszawskie Wydawnictwo Literackie

### Regional and Dialect Translations

Poland has a unique tradition of translating "The Little Prince" into various regional languages and dialects:

- In Poland, The Little Prince was also published in Lemko language – Малий Прінц (ISBN 978-83-936592-0-3) and Prussian – Līkuts Princis (ISBN 978-83-65053-00-8)
- In 2015, Juliusz Kubel translated the work into Poznań dialect, giving it the title "Książę Szaranek." A year later, the book "Książę Szaranek" was published by Media Rodzina publishing house (ISBN 978-83-8008-291-5)
- In 2018, a translation into Kashubian was published. Maciej Bandur translated from the original, giving the Kashubian version the title "Môłi princ"
- The Little Prince was also translated into Silesian ethnolect and Masurian dialect

### Modern Digital Editions

In 2021, the Modern Poland Foundation, which runs the Wolne Lektury (Free Readings) online library, published the first Polish translation of the book under a free license (Free Art License 1.3). The translator is Agata Kozak.

The edition with original illustrations by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry in Agata Kozak's new translation is available as an e-book (EPUB and Mobi Kindle) and PDF file. The audiobook prepared especially for Wolne Lektury featured Katarzyna Faszczewska.

### Educational Use

The Little Prince is required reading in Poland. It became mandatory reading for grade VIII of primary school in 2017 and was still so in 2024.

The extensive publication history shows that "Mały Książę" has been one of the most beloved and frequently republished books in Poland, with dozens of publishers and numerous translators contributing to making this classic available to Polish readers across different generations and regions.
